_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The seven people who are worthy of offer: The first person who meditates observing impermanence in the eye and realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life.
The second person who meditates observing impermanence in the eye and has their defilements and their life come to an end at exactly the same time.
The third person who meditates observing impermanence in the eye and is extinguished between one life and the next with the ending of the five lower fetters.
The fourth person who meditates observing impermanence in the eye and is extinguished upon landing with the ending of the five lower fetters.
The fifth person who meditates observing impermanence in the eye and is extinguished without extra effort with the ending of the five lower fetters.
The sixth person who meditates observing impermanence in the eye and is extinguished with extra effort with the ending of the five lower fetters.
The seventh person who meditates observing impermanence in the eye and heads upstream, going to the Akaniṭṭha realm with the ending of the five lower fetters.
